comments.commentBody: There's been allegations that millions upon millions went to Trump real estate properties from Russian oligarchs. I wish there would be definitive reporting on who, what, where, when regarding the entire life span of Trump's involvement with Russians. Someone needs to report on the entirety of his involvement with his Russian mistresses.
Mistresses? Is that the word for it now??

Check out Rachel Maddow on MSNBC to see Trump's relationship with an oligarch (the so-called king of fertilizer). As Maddow reported, follow the money but also follow the private jets.

Or the relationship of Trump's new Commerce Secretary, to another Russian oligarch who is said to be extremely close to V.Putin. They serve together on the board of the Bank of Cyprus, said to be a money-laundering operation.

That was my first thought for that answer as well.

It's only appeared in a puzzle once before (in 1984) and was clued as "Bogart film: 1941."

Actually, I will take the debate about which lies were worse, Clinton's or Sessions'.  Clinton's lies had nothing to do with his work for or loyalty to the American people, it was about loyalty to his wife.  How loyal Clinton was to his wife was never the public's business in the first place, but there should never be any doubt about a public servant' loyalty to country.  This question of loyalty has contaminated the entire Trump administration.
And speaking of loyalty to ones wife...I give your Marla Maples!

Lots to investigate.

But whether there's ultimately a there there or not, the dems in congress owe us all a massive, unrelenting, overwhelming push-back against Trumpism.

Unlike the gop's manufactured scandals intended to blockade Obama & HRC for no reason than to be obstructive, there is profound danger in this entire administration.

It's too late to actually stop them, and this will be a vastly harder fight than if the dems had just gotten out the vote. But fight they must!

Just don't let Scott Pruitt out your sights, journalists. All this flak about Russian collusion conspiracy will conspire to distract from what Trump & Pruitt have planned, which is nothing less than the complete cannibalism of the planet & all who live thereon, for unfettered profiteering.

Take a look at what's actually going on in Coal Country, on the ground. This is the future Trumpism promises for America & the world:

http://appvoices.org/end-mountaintop-removal/community/

Coal River Mountain Watch:
http://crmw.net/

I'll summarize under 1,500 characters.

Trump knows all about witch hunts. He called Clinton "The Devil" at a campaign appearance. He's a lying Devil.

We are so inclined to think badly about Russia because of our education, but maybe these talks were just very harmless or meant to assure Russia of future peace. The troubling part is that Putin is so bad and Trump is too and they like each other. Putin may not represent the wishes of everyday Russians just as Trump doesn't represent us.

Trump crossed the red line when he asked Russia to hack Clinton's emails.

Not enough attention is devoted to Manafort who had contacts with Russian Television. Trump is the Television industry man.

I think everyone is too hard on Sessions. I think he just didn't focus under questioning by Franken due to the stress of the appearance.

This is bigger than just Russia electing Trump. So did the F.B.I. and three former federal prosecutors; Sessions, Christie and Giuliani. There just had to be communications among them.

Senator Sessions is now Attorney General. He may have been appointed just to forestall any investigations of Trump.

As details emerge about contacts between American and Russian players, lets stay focused on Trump who is pulling all the strings. The man is the Marionette.

I see further motives yet to be discovered. Both the Russians and the Feds getting Trump elected is indicative of some kind of underlying intrigue between our governments.

This might be peace efforts.

This is a witch hunt. Already have caught one witch, Flynn and about to capture another witch, Sessions.
So hi ho off we go waiting for another snitch to help catch another Trump witch.

How much more obvious can it be? Our arch enemy - the Russians - have infiltrated the White House.

There it is.

Inquiring minds (and reporters) should want to know: If these contacts were "routine," as the Administration insists, what contacts did each of these Trump associates have with representatives of Great Britain? of Germany? of France? of China? If it turns out that the numbers match, then ok, yes, maybe it was "routine" and nothing to worry about.  If not....
Lying under oath is not a good look
Tax returns.
Trump just isn't the sort one consents to be governed by, if one believes reason and equitable negotiation are crucial elements of sustainable civilized public behavior.

@CEO, @EHJ
While Republicans go after MAGA, Democrats can kiss g'bye to 2020, 2024 etc. and pursue their allegations at their leisure and content. Use the parry funds, don't ask the tax payers to pay for your inane investigations.
Does the simple statement that the Chief Rabbi of Russia (a Lubavicher) is an "ally of Putin" bother no one else?

Out of the chaos came one positive result -- AG Sessions was forced to turn over the Russia investigation to a career attorney. Assistant AG Dana Boente has presided over high-profile public corruption cases in Virginia and Louisiana. Now it is up to him to appoint a credible special counsel to oversee the investigation into Russian influence in the election and collaboration with the Trump campaign and associates. The sooner the better for our country.

A simple question (which will almost certainly never be answered) to A.G. Sessions is this: Would Senator Sessions call for a special prosecutor if a scenario like this were unfolding under a President Hillary Clinton?
It's not only about what they have done, but also about what they are doing about it now to hide it. Everything has to be scrutinized continuously.
I prefer war served up cold.

There's an easy question to be answered: what appropriate, clean, necessary, patriotic reasons could all of these people have had for meeting with Russian diplomats, oligarchs, and politicians? Anybody? Anything?

This has been Republican strategy for some time think Nixon meeting with So Vietnam encouraging the boycotting of peace talks for domestic political gain. Reagan dealing with Iran to keep the hostages until after the election and then trading arms for their release. Now trump and Russia it doesn't take much to imagine trump's smarmy lieutenants Bannon, Miller, and Sessions making a similar play. This is just business as usual for Republicans.
We weren't being hacked by them then. Big difference.

I'm not so sure it's buyer's remorse. One plausible theory is that Putin desires a domestically distracted US separated from her traditional European allies. With the chaos the Trump Administration is bringing he will be able to expand in eastern Europe.

In unrelated news Sweden has reinstated a military draft.
It would be game over if only, we could see them Trump Tax returns. But, as in  everything else the more they fight against the guiltier they look and most likely are.
Chaos theorists find the self-organization of nihilism one of the greatest ironies of reality.

This article is what plagues American journalism. It lists every alleged contact between the Trump campaign and Russia. It equates wild unverifiable allegations with facts documented by the FBI and the CIA.
Patience and hard work are virtues. There are well documented private contacts by General Flynn and Senator Sessions, during the campaign with Russia. Some of these contacts were with members of Russian intelligence (Russian intelligence during a Presidential campaign??). Both Flynn and Sessions also misled Congress and Vice President Pence. Sessions even falsely testified that he had no such private contacts with the Russian ambassador i
When Sessions finally admitted that he had met privately with the Russian ambassador in his office just days before Russia dumped thousands of emails that Russia had criminally stolen from Democratic Headquarters, he refused to deny that the presidential campaign was not discussed. Instead Sessions said, "Ambassadors are chatty." But I don't recall any such conversations. Sessions also failed to explain why the Russian Ambassador took the unheard of step of meeting privately with Sessions in his office when the Russian Ambassador universally telephones calls other Senators.
These two incidence are the veins that will lead to the mother lode. At the very least Flynn and Sessions knowingly misled the US government and its citizens on matters of grave public concern,. They have thereby forfeited the right to hold an office of public trust.

Everyone needs to take a deep breath and remember that a) it is not illegal to speak to Russians and many elected officials do so on a regular basis.  b) its perfectly acceptable for an incoming administration to begin to establish a relationship with representatives from other countries c) there is not one shred of evidence ... NOTHING ... to suggest that there was collusion between the Russian's and Trump's people.  Anything you think is evidence is speculation and innuendo at this point and nothing more.    The one piece of evidence that we do have is that democrats have publicly stated their intention to ignore the election results and do everything in their power to topple this president.  That is far, far worse than anything Trump or his people have done.  The investigation has begun. Let's see where the facts lead us and until then, let the president to the job the American people elected him to do.  The democrats are making fools of themselves.

NO more than the Republicans of the last eight years. Tit for Tat I say. Obstruct, flummox, castigate, scream, accuse. Some of it will finally stick and the facts be damned. This is a perfect exercise of the lessons of the past eight years, and you know what, it worked. My only fear is the Democrats have this streak of humanity and reason that will probably hamstring their efforts.

OK, you might remember the impeachment of Bill Clinton or the absolute refusal of Republicans in Congress to cooperate with President Obama for 8 years. Did the Republicans do everything in their power to topple the Democratic Presidents? Yes they did.

Why the unwavering bromance with the thug Putin? Why all the perjurious denial of contacts?

BTW Would not Flynn's false denials, he they gone undectected, compromised him to Russian blackmail? What about Sessions? IF he did speak about campaign-related issues (and lying under oath to congress has a smoking gun quality to it) is our AG not now owned lock-stock&barrell by the Russian intelligence ??
